components.description: The fingers of a hand sticking up in the air.
Imagine a blanket draped over something and the edges hanging down.
Can mean each / every (and serves as the phonetic component)
A cloud (originally also “say” or “speech” in ancient scripts).

interpretation:
Although it might feel intuitive to interpret 云 as being “above” the person (since clouds are above people), **the actual character has 人 on top** and 云 underneath.

What might this symbolize?
• A {人:person} standing over or leading a **group / thought / idea** (云).
• Or a **person coming together over shared speech** (云) — pointing to meanings like:
	• to meet
	• to understand
	• to be able to do something (as in potential)
• a meeting or event

components.description: A stylized sweeping enclosure (not a box!) that suggests oversight or constraint.
“one” or “a single”. Symbolic of singular authority or order.
“mouth” → speech, command. Often implies speaking, orders, or delegation.

interpretation:
① **One** voice ({口:-mouth}) speaks under a single command ({一:-one}), all under the control of a higher authority ({𠃌:radical} wrapping stroke) — someone is in **charge**.

Or more vivid:

② Imagine a **manager’s voice** ({口:-mouth}) under a **single rule** ({一:-one}) — all wrapped tightly by an **enclosure** ({𠃌:-radical}) like a rolled scroll or decree. The person speaking isn’t just talking — they speak with **authority**. This is someone who **oversees, commands**, or **manages**.

components.description: Indicates the object is made of metal — commonly used for tools, coins, and instruments.
Gives the sound zhōng and suggests something resonating from the center

interpretation: A metal ({钅:-metal}) object that resonates from its center ({中:-middle}) — a bell, and by extension, clocks.

components.description: Phonetic — gives the sound zhì → shì (not a perfect match), also adds meaning nuance: “to reach” or “to go to (a place)”

interpretation: A roof ({宀:-roof}) over the place you arrive ({至:-arrive}) — that’s a room.

components.description: Semantic — bamboo radical, often associated with lightness, playfulness, or bamboo-based items
Phonetic + symbolic — contributes to the sound and evokes a joyful, lively figure

interpretation: A lively person ({夭:-young}) paired with bamboo ({𥫗:-bamboo}) — together evoking the lightness and joy of laughter or **smiling**.

components.description: Symbolic — may represent an imbalance, fall, or drooping movement
Semantic — person with arms outstretched, represents a person or vitality, common in human-related characters

interpretation: A person ({大:-big}) under a slanting stroke ({丿:-slash}) — symbolizing either wilting, youthful delicacy, or a life cut short.
